tests.prompt: During combat, verify the bottom panel displays: character portrait/icon, name, and class/level (e.g., 'Thorin - Level 3 Fighter').
During combat, verify HP bar shows current/max values (e.g., '45/52 HP') with visual bar that changes color based on health percentage (green > yellow > red).
During combat, verify Armor Class is prominently displayed with shield icon (e.g., 'AC 16').
When character has active conditions (Rage, Blessed, Poisoned, etc.), verify badges appear with appropriate icons. Badges should show condition name on hover.
Verify action economy indicators show: movement remaining (e.g., '30/30 ft'), action available (filled/empty dot), bonus action available (filled/empty dot), reaction available (filled/empty dot).
Verify main hand and off hand weapon slots are displayed with weapon name, damage dice (e.g., 'Longsword 1d8 slashing'). Empty slots should show 'Empty' or similar.
Clicking an equipped weapon should initiate an attack (same as clicking Attack button). Verify weapon slots are interactive.
For a Fighter character, verify action buttons show: Attack, Move, Second Wind (if available), Action Surge (if available), Backpack. NOT generic spell button.
For a Wizard character, verify action buttons show: Attack, Move, Spell (opens spell list), Backpack. Should NOT show Rage or Second Wind.
For a Barbarian character, verify action buttons show: Attack, Move, Rage (toggleable), Reckless Attack (if available), Backpack.
Clicking Backpack button opens inventory modal showing character's items. Should be accessible for all classes.
Verify CombatHistoryPanel is positioned in right sidebar (not overlapping main battle map). Should be scrollable with recent entries visible.
In combat log entries, verify dice rolls are highlighted: natural 1s in red, natural 20s (crits) in gold. Damage sources show appropriate icons.
On smaller screens, verify the combat panel adapts gracefully - equipment might collapse, but core actions remain accessible.
